newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to offer Quicken on desktop.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to offer Quicken on desktop.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said Thursday it has agreed to include Intuit Inc's Quicken Financial Network (QuickenFN) as an active channel on its Internet Explorer 4.0 software.

When QuickenFN is preconfigured with Internet Explorer 4.0, it will appear as a mini-window on the consumer's desktop. The channel will offer financial news, personal finance tips, planning tools, products and services.
Microsoft said the Intuit agreement is the third of its kind, after PointCast Inc and MSNBC.
In a joint statement, Microsoft and Intuit also said that Intuit will integrate Microsoft Internet Explorer 3.0 and 4.0 into its Quicken, QuickBooks and TurboTax product lines.
Financial terms of the deals were not disclosed.
